{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the relevant documents, Bakers anchorage is a type of intermaxillary anchorage. This type of anchorage involves using elastics from one jaw to the other, with either Class 2 elastics (moving upper teeth back) or Class 3 elastics (moving lower teeth back) serving as anchors. Intramaxillary anchorage is also mentioned, but it refers to the use of elastics within the same jaw to move teeth back of the mouth. Extraoral anchorage and muscular anchorage are not specifically mentioned in relation to Bakers anchorage.", "answer_choice": "B"}
